H0.text: Situated in the West Pennine Moors, what are Turton and Entwistle, Jumbles and Wayoh. Reservoirs

H1.text: Situated in the West Pennine Moors, what are Turton and Entwistle, Jumbles and Wayoh. Hills

H2.text: Situated in the West Pennine Moors, what are Turton and Entwistle, Jumbles and Wayoh. Valleys

H3.text: Situated in the West Pennine Moors, what are Turton and Entwistle, Jumbles and Wayoh. Headpond

A4.text: Turton and Entwistle Reservoir is a water reservoir in the village of Edgworth, Lancashire, England.

A5.text: The reservoir contains almost 750 thousand imperial gallons (roughly 3,400,000 litres) and, with the Wayoh Reservoir just below, satisfies around 50% of Bolton's need for drinking water.
